Very thought proviking, as a Mother I found it very frustrating and

Heart warming great game it reminds me refugee children. Just would be nice 
to see results of our choices in the end too
Beautiful and emotional
Such a simple game but also it's very sad I hope you make more games

This game is incredible, the story telling is moving and heart wrenchingly 
beautiful. Highly recommend.

I loved this game! I've played it dozens of tines. I need a sequel, now 
pls. It's a very quick game, about 5-7hrs of gameplay. However I absolutely 
fell in love with Karin in that time. Suggestion: there are a few points 
where a stat screen appears, it'd be nice to see your choices for every 
chapter at the end of the game.

I loved every second of it. I kept getting really sad when she was sad and 
tried doing everything to cheer her up. Game glitched once but fixed 
itself. Graffics were great and story line evem better
Great game. Definitely worth buying.

It's a really nice game. You have to take care of a child that was born in 
a war context. It can be very challenging because you need to deal with 
many feelings, you need to teach your kid how to deal with bullies, etc.. 
You adopt the child and there are different choices of parenting

Wow wow wow. What an amazing and tear jerker game full of feels. I'm not 
even a parent but have been bullied in the past and even growing as a jew 
in Israel, I was constantly harassed because my family is of a German 
background (German Jews, but that didn't seem to matter to cruel kids). I 
wish there was an epilogue where we saw what happened in the new town... I 
really felt like Karin was a real kid and I wish so much the best for 
her... 😢
Very good game

It gives a second point of view from the parent's side to children growing 
up bullied and discriminated. As someone who had experienced both these 
things while growing up in our modern society (that sadly at times isn't 
much different from the past), I painfully understand and sympathize with 
My Child Lebensborn and the tough times and depression they went through. 
After playing this magnificent game, I feel closer to my parents and 
understand better the uncertainty and inner distress they felt throughout 
my childhood. Thank you.

I cried. This game was super deep and relatable and it hurts me how evil 
this world is
Absolutely fantastic! Really pulls you in!
I is a really good game. I actually feel bad about what happen to these kids
I love this game! Loading screen takes forever.
Buy it now!

I want to cry. Just finished the game. I never knew about the plight of 
these children so this game was educational in that regard. My heart breaks 
for any child that was treated like this one. I was iffy about whether to 
purchase, but it was worth it. I'm cuddling my own baby close now. Thank 
you for showing me what life was like for them. Well done.

This game remind me of my childhood, I was the victim of bullying too, and 
this game made me in tears

I wasn't ready for that feel trip when I started this game. But in the end 
it was so worth it. It packs such an emotional punch that comes with 
raising a war child, and at the same time, forces us to reflect on history 
from a different perspective. Well worth the price tag.

So touching. I genuinely grew attached to Karin and hearing all the true 
stories just breaks your heart.

I've only heard good things about this game so I decided to buy it for 
myself, however, it won't open? it loads to 97% post introduction/child 
adoption and then crashes. is there anything I can do?
replyContent: Hello, I am sorry to hear about this. What type of device do you have and how old is it? We see that some may have problems with very old phones. Please email us at support@sareptastudio.com and we will look at how to solve this.

content:
Wonderful game. I m not used to write reviews but this game deserves one. 
Really passionate, hard, you can t make it good but you can try to not make 
it worst... At least. Really make you think about the life of these people 
around you

One of the best mobile games I've played with an amazing moving storyline, 
worth much more than the price tag

This game is amazing. I got hooked and played it through in one day. It's 
the most emotional game I ever played. Making its money worth many times.

The game's story presents realistic tough decisions in a historical setting 
and heartwrenching content as you fend for your adopted child and make 
decisions on his/her behalf despite the risks. It was a great experience 
that you should give your full attention to while playing (with sound on) 
for the best enjoyment.
Really good game. I loved it.

I just finished playing it, my heart pulled at the end. Not because it was 
happy or sad, but so true. I myself have suffered through experiences 
similar to the boy's experience, for being autistic and having been born to 
a single mother. Along with it, it shows us an aspect of history very few 
consider. I would have never thought of this point from the characters 
point of view.

It sucked me in right away. I ended up finishing the story in less than a 
day, but I still want to play it more. I really care about Karin. It's a 
5/5, but I do wish the game was longer or had a better replayability. I'm 
gonna try to get Karin all the toys this time.

Game was short. Would have liked to have a second chapter or at least an 
end of game summary- you kept child % content. Child trust x%..

This game deserves more than 5 stars. It's difficult but not too hard. It's 
emotional and well written. I suffered with the child, I cried, i got 
angry. And even though it's set in norway and after WW2, it's still 
relevant today. Wort every penny.

5 starts is not enough. Very emotional game, and even though it's set after 
ww2, it is very relatable to today. It shows how vulnerable parents are 
when dealing with situations like their kids getting bullied. Thank you!

This is the best mobile game I've ever played. Truly eye-opening and 
heartbreaking. I can't recommend it enough.

Amazing and moving story. Absolutely brilliant! And definitely worth the 
money.

From the start, it gripped me! Seeing my "child" develop through their life 
and through the harshness they experienced. Those special memories and 
moments really got me and overall this game has a special place in my 
heart! It was heartbreaking, breathtaking, heart pumping and a beautiful 
journey to have taken with my "child!" It felt like i was their parent in 
the game i wish i could be there for them as they faced the harsh reality! 
A solid solid piece of brilliantly done masterpiece of a game! Thank you 
very much to the developers! Please make some more games like this!

Abseloutly magnificent game. I felt so connected to the child and never 
have I ever experienced truely what was it like to be a lonely mother of a 
single child. Abseloutly 10/10

This is one of the best mobile games I've run across to! I was genuinely 
worried about my child when he went missing. I even cried at some moments 
of what he had to go through. I wanted to sheltered him from everything but 
I knew I need to raise him to be strong as well and not to give up. This is 
one of the greatest gameplay I've ever experienced!
Truly a moving experience. Highly recommended.

Amazing, i just wished to know what happend with Klaus and if he was ok 
after we moved. Such an amazing game. Not regretting even a little bit for 
bying this game, it was worth every second! Good job guys!
Amazing game, well done, nice gfx and a interesting story.

Quite possibly the best mobile game I've played. Just need to play one more 
day... ok one more...

Beautiful game, with a touching story and nice music. Would recommend the 
game to everyone looking for a good story driven game.

Just finished playing and I'm torn to shreds. I did my best to protect my 
son from bullying, but juggling work and the various acts of cruelty from 
the community was so challenging. I learned a lot about the history of 
Children Born of War, about Norwegian culture and food, and maybe something 
about parenting too.

The game manages to tell a really gripping story and make you care alot 
about the child. Every choice you take feels like it matters. Highly 
recommended!

This is just a brilliant game. I am so glad I backed this on Kickstarter. 
Pure emotion from beginning to end, with a perfect setting and very 
detailed portrayal of a post-WWII mentality towards German infants. Highly 
recommended to buy this gem.
I was crying by the end of the game. It was really intense. I highly recommend it.

A game about taking care of your little one. Touching and important to 
think about.
This game is very good and touching, but it has a lot of bugs.
